Start a Community Garden: Create a shared garden in your neighborhood where you can grow your own fruits and vegetables. This way, you can ensure a steady supply of fresh produce and have a sense of accomplishment in seeing your hard work pay off. You can also share the produce with your neighbors, fostering a sense of community and cooperation.

Learn Herbalism: Study the medicinal properties of plants and herbs that are native to your area. By learning how to identify and use these plants, you can create your own natural remedies for common ailments. This way, you can maintain your health without relying on modern medical facilities.

Build a Rainwater Collection System: Install a rainwater collection system in your home to collect and store rainwater for drinking, cooking, and personal hygiene. This way, you can have access to clean drinking water even if medical facilities disappear.

Create a DIY First Aid Kit: Assemble a kit with basic first aid supplies such as bandages, antiseptic wipes, and pain relievers. This way, you can treat minor injuries and illnesses without needing to visit a doctor.

Learn Traditional Healing Techniques: Study traditional healing techniques such as acupuncture, massage, and meditation. These practices can help you maintain your physical and mental health without relying on modern medicine.
